qas.question: ACLs and capability based security are two security models capable of what?
A host computer tricked into indirectly allowing access to restricted files is known as what?
The confused deputy problem and the problem of not guaranteeing only one person has access are resolved by what?
What must designers of systems that are ACL based do?

answers.text: take responsibility to ensure that they do not introduce flaws

plausible_answers.text: to be insecure in many situations

qas.question: What has using ACLs to confine programs proven?
How can a computer with ACL be tricked?
Which two models in computer systems enforce privilege separation?

plausible_answers.text: can never be guaranteed in practice

qas.question: Can an ACLs limit access to one person?
What is the total number of security models in a computer system?

plausible_answers.text: if the host computer can be tricked into indirectly allowing restricted file access

qas.question: When is an ACL most secure?
What prevents ACLs from giving access to only one person?

plausible_answers.text: access to an object to only one person

qas.question: Who is not responsible for the flaws in an ACL system?

context: Within computer systems, <b9_0>two<b9_0/> of many security models capable of <a1_0>enforcing privilege separation<a1_0/> are <a0_0>access control lists<a0_0/> <b7_0>(ACLs) and capability-based security<b7_0/>. Using ACLs to confine programs has been proven <b5_0>to be insecure in many situations<b5_0/>, such as <b10_0>if the host computer can be tricked into <b6_0>indirectly allowing restricted file access<b10_0/><b6_0/>, an issue known as <a2_0>the confused deputy problem<a2_0/>. It has also been shown that the promise of ACLs of giving <b12_0>access to an object to only one person<b12_0/> <b8_0>can never be guaranteed in practice<b8_0/>. Both of these problems are resolved by <a3_0><b11_0>capabilities<b11_0/><a3_0/>. This does not mean practical flaws exist in all ACL-based systems, but only that <b13_0>the designers<b13_0/> of certain utilities must <a4_0>take responsibility to ensure that they do not introduce flaws<a4_0/>.[citation needed]
